item.title: Actuarial Risk Models
item.description: Modeling the aggregate claim amount where each claim amount is a random variable and the number of claims is also a random variable is important in actuarial science. We present a general class of distributions whose characteristics can be used to develop an ad-hoc procedure for determining which distribution is appropriate for the number of claims based on observed data. If the claim amounts take on only positive integer values, we derive the distribution of the aggregate claim amount.

item.title: About Me
item.description: As a student at Southern Illinois University Edwardsville majoring in Actuarial Science, I am excited to start my career as an entry-level actuary. With a degree in Actuarial Science and strong proficiency in statistical analysis and programming software such as R, SAS, SQL, and Excel; I am able to tackle complex problems and provide effective solutions for risk management. I am competent contributing to a team environment, and look forward to developing my own skills and knowledge in the actuarial field.
